content:
Certainly! Here's a step-by-step guide to cooking a vegan lasagna from scratch:

Ingredients:
- 12 lasagna noodles
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 zucchini, chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, chopped
- 1 green bell pepper, chopped
- 1 can of crushed tomatoes (about 15 oz)
- 1 tsp dried basil
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 1/2 cup vegan parmesan cheese (optional)
- 1 cup vegan mozzarella cheese, shredded
- 1 cup raw cashews, soaked overnight
- 2 tbsp nutritional yeast
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 1 tsp garlic powder
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 2 cups spinach leaves, chopped

Instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. Cook your lasagna noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.

3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.

4. Add the chopped zucchini, red bell pepper, and green bell pepper to the skillet. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10-12 minutes.

5. Add the canned crushed tomatoes, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. Stir to combine and let the sauce simmer for about 10 minutes.

6. In a blender or food processor, combine the drained cashews, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, black pepper, and 1 cup of water. Blend until smooth and creamy.

7. Spread a thin layer of the tomato sauce on the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.

8. Place a layer of cooked lasagna noodles on top of the sauce, overlapping slightly if necessary.

9. Spread a layer of the cashew cream over the noodles.

10. Add a layer of spinach leaves over the cashew cream.

11. Spoon a layer of the tomato sauce over the spinach leaves.

12. Sprinkle some vegan parmesan cheese (if using) and vegan mozzarella cheese over the tomato sauce.

13. Repeat the layers of noodles, cashew cream, spinach leaves, tomato sauce, and cheese until all of your ingredients have been used.

14. Cover your lasagna with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.

15. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, until the cheeses are melted and bubbly.

16. Let your lasagna cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your homemade vegan lasagna!
